Detailed Description

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
class stemming::norwegian_stem< string_typeT >

The Norwegian alphabet includes the following additional letters:
     -æ å ø

The following letters are vowels:
     -a e i o u y æ å ø

R2 is not used: R1 is defined in the same way as in the German stemmer.

Define a valid s-ending as one of
     -b c d f g h j l m n o p r t v y z,
     -or k not preceded by a vowel.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::norwegian_stem< string_typeT >::operator() ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline]

Parameters:
text string to stem

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::norwegian_stem< string_typeT >::step_1 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Search for the longest among the following suffixes in R1, and perform the action indicated. -a e ede ande ende ane ene hetene en heten ar er heter as es edes endes enes hetenes ens hetens ers ets et het ast -delete -s -delete if preceded by a valid s-ending

-erte ert -replace with er

(Of course the letter of the valid s-ending is not necessarily in R1)

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::norwegian_stem< string_typeT >::step_2 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

If the word ends dt or vt in R1, delete the t. (For example, meldt -> meld, operativt -> operativ)

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::norwegian_stem< string_typeT >::step_3 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Search for the longest among the following suffixes in R1, and if found, delete.

-leg eleg ig eig lig elig els lov elov slov hetslov
